This review isn't for the tremendous amount of good taste Dave's Hot Chicken offers both for its tenders/sliders and fries. But rather for the staff attitude & their customer service. Dave's Hot Chicken was established by a few close friends or cousins based off of a parking lot years ago. We got take out about 4-5 years ago when they only had their LA location and fell in love with this business establishment. I have also been to North Hollywood one & it's equally amazing. I placed the pickup order through Yelp on Sunday night when the rain was making this quarantine situation even more unbearable and my husband and I went to LA to pick it up. I asked the nice guy at the counter if I could tip them in cash because I paid for dinner with my card but he said they don't accept tips! #quarantineAndreview so I owe it to these guys to at least leave a nice review. Hope this helps thriving their business even more! We had two sliders with fries and a side of extra slider (two mild flavors for hubby and the medium hot for me). They offer a free side with the Yelp check in & since I did the same nice guy gave us two kaleslaws which is my absolute favorite side they offer. All 5/5! The only suggestion that I've for them is to offer delivery. That'll be more and more popular very soon!

Simply delicious and definitely coming back! I came during the middle of COVID-19 so there wasn't much of a line, first time ever, the parking is not great - side street parking. Place is easy to find, straightforward menu. I got the Combo #3 with a tender, a slider, and some fries. Can't be more happy with the food! I live 20 miles away so the 20 mile drive back was excruciating, having to smell the good food radiating out of my passenger seat. The chicken is amazing, it wasn't too dry but it wasn't overly juicy. I got the mild spice level and it was perfect for me. The sauce they give you is similar to something you'd get at Raising Canes. I didn't have a timer going but I finished the box of food so quick just because it was that good. I'm definitely coming back to support them during this quarantine. PROS: - Tasty and delicious - Quick service CONS: - Parking is not great - Could be a line waiting if going during peak hours

I came here to order takeout and I heard it was similar to Howlin Rays, so I decided to give it a try. I've never been to Howlin' Rays, but I was excited to eat here because I've never had hot chicken before. And let me tell you it was delicious!!! I checked in for a free side and it was so big I couldn't believe it was offered as a yelp check in. I got sliders and fries with a free side of cheese fries and I barely made a dent in my cheese fries and I got full after 1 slider... a size of a regular burger! Their portions and huge and it was for a decent price in my opinion. I'm definitely going to come back here. During these times, obviously we couldn't eat inside, so we just ate on our car in the parking lot and my experience was fantastic! it was also good the next day heated up!

I love Dave's Hot Chicken! I remember when the line curved alongside the other businesses but now they have multiple locations across LA. Now, their service is speedy and the chicken is the best. Order the tender and slider it's more than enough for one person. I usually get the hot level it is not that spicy. Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free side or drink.

(Took Out 02/25/20 TU @ 4:15pm): OK Dave... I was pleased with your hot chicken, but how were you out of mac & cheese!? I've had Dave's Hot Chicken bookmarked since they finally opened their brick-and-mortar slightly more than two years ago (previously a pop-up affair). I wasn't one to be carried away by the trending wave of Nashville hot chicken businesses that have pecked their way onto the food farm scene; rather, I simply liked a good piece of chicken with some noticeable spiciness minus the insane lines at a reasonable prices. Was Dave able to provide this to me as my "Fat Tuesday" meal before the start of the Lenten season!? PURCHASE Kale Slaw ($3.50): I'm not a kale fan, but I wanted something green and this was the only option on the menu. To my surprise, it was rather cleansing, not liquidy at all, and I felt healthier https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Tr9SgimQuQ1ttZd1iitbrw&userid=8jVT2inwc8GIQ6sH2UG9Vw! Hot Seasoned Chicken Tender w/Sliced White Bread ($3.50): Ordered by default because they were sold out of mac & cheese and wanted to order everything possible on their short menu, this nicely-fried dark color piece of hot poultry with its plain fluffy bread was a lovely appetizer before the main meal https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uKq0uxx3qG8kfQsrQaZzwQ&userid=8jVT2inwc8GIQ6sH2UG9Vw! Combo #2 2 Hot Seasoned Chicken Sliders w/Hot Seasoned Crinkled Fries + Cheese ($12.99 + $1.00): At this point, one chicken slider was enough but I proudly powered through at devoured both along with the fries. Each slider was a sloppy two-handed finger-licking-good hot mess as I tried to control the avalanche of ingredients from slipping out. I should've asked for more pickles, the cheese slice was pedestrian to the meal, and the kale slaw dressing was redundant since I ordered a separate side. Although the hot level gave me vapors, I felt I was man enough for the next "extra hot" or even final "reaper" levels, respectively. The fries were plentiful, perfectly crispy on the outside, moist/warm on the inside, and truly didn't need any ketchup and such. This was one very good meal https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Xf7KpC4uOkUcnbDyzKcS1g&userid=8jVT2inwc8GIQ6sH2UG9Vw! SERVICE Thankfully, the line was short with only four people in front of me. After about a 10-minute wait, I easily placed my order, got a number, and about another 10-minute wait later I was called up to the pick-up counter with my entire order all packaged up and ready to go. Everyone I dealt with was chill, cool, and appeared to have a fun time. Kudos to everyone! PARKING (FREE; $1.00 this instance) Located in a small-medium strip mall with limited parking, I found a 2-hour timed meter at a nearby corner. Otherwise, there were plenty of metered and timed parking along the main drag of Western Ave. and all surrounding streets. ATMOSPHERE, DÉCOR, AMBIENCE A surprisingly roomy reverse L-shaped floorplan filled with several tables and chairs, there was a short line path that led from the front door straight to the order counter directly in front of you while the pick-up counter was just around the corner to your right. A handful of promotional posters hung on the walls but generally a nicely-kept restaurant. Plenty of natural lighting came through the two full glass walls and front door while soul-sucking electric fluorescent ceiling lights covered the rest. I counted four muted TVs https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=7Xfmf63Ci9txGRMalykoAQ&userid=8jVT2inwc8GIQ6sH2UG9Vw while chillout music played in the background. ATTIRE Totally casual, so I would normally be in a t-shirt, boardshorts, and flip-flops. OVERALL I was happy to have finally tried Dave's Hot Chicken and was a good gluttonous meal before Lent. The menu was extremely limited (they also had a small collection of standard bottled beer), so unless you really loved their take on Nashville hot fried chicken, your visits may be limited. Although I enjoyed the food and felt it was reasonably priced, I would be an occasional diner at best (I needed to try the mac & cheese!) if I needed a chicken fix since they were relatively close to me. Plus, it was always a pleasure to support a mom & pop small business. I found very good value based on the prices, service, and experience noted above (TOTAL paid experience was around $22.00 BEFORE any discounts and/or tip). And, they accepted my credit card of choice... AMEX! 4.0 STARS

With the recent trend of hot chicken establishments popping up all around Los Angeles, it would take a lot for an establishment to really separate itself from the rest of the pack. Whether that's from word of mouth, special cooking style, use of seasonings or whatever, it really is a tough field to distinguish yourself from. Dave's Hot Chicken on Western does it pretty well. They are not without their flaws, but from a straight taste and enjoyment perspective, this location does it pretty well. As expected, you come here for the hot chicken. Period. Don't bother with anything else. They have good fries, but that's not what you're here for and that's definitely not why you wait in line for. Speaking of the line, this place has a tendency to have pretty long lines. Obviously, during the COVID times, that line isn't that much of an issue as you would order online and pick up your order at certain times, but they do have a tendency to get backed up so use your best judgement. The current menu is limited, but luckily the combo's are portioned very well and are very filling. The chicken, depending on your spice tolerance can range from mild to burnt your tongue off, but I found their spicy to be an enjoyable spicy and not numbing to the point of being painful. That's the key difference. You can still taste the complexity in their flavors, where other places you cannot and for me that's what makes them unique. Good thing is they do have other locations, but still expect a wait if you're arriving at rush hours. However, I am glad that they're open and serving during these times. Definitely a place to support if you can.

The wait wasn't bad at all, but it was more than I expected for that time of night. Maybe about 20-25 min from lining up to getting our food? Service was alright, but there was a hiccup. We ordered cheese fries. As we were waiting for them to call our number, we see them tell a customer ahead of us that they ran out of cheese sauce for their fries. He got comped with TWO orders of mac and cheese instead. As we continue to wait, we see an employee walk into the kitchen with 2 cans of cheese sauce to restock. When our number was called, nobody said anything about our cheese fries so we figured we were all good. We walked back to our car about a block away, and luckily, I wanted to snack in the car. That's when we discovered our plain fries. Had to walk it back to complain, and they comped us with ONE order of mac and cheese. So unfair. Why'd the other customer get 2 when I had to actually bring my order back? That being said, that mac and cheese was so bomb. Definitely getting that again. Even the regular fries were perfectly seasoned. I was so happy with my sides that I'm not even mad about the service. As for the chicken, it was pretty good.     Kale Slaw ($3.50): I'm not a kale fan, but I wanted something green and this was the only option on the menu. To my surprise, it was rather cleansing, not liquidy at all, and I felt healthier yelp.com/user_local_phot…!

    Hot Seasoned Chicken Tender w/Sliced White Bread ($3.50): Ordered by default because they were sold out of mac & cheese and wanted to order everything possible on their short menu, this nicely-fried dark color piece of hot poultry with its plain fluffy bread was a lovely appetizer before the main meal yelp.com/user_local_phot…!

    Combo #2 2 Hot Seasoned Chicken Sliders w/Hot Seasoned Crinkled Fries + Cheese ($12.99 + $1.00): At this point, one chicken slider was enough but I proudly powered through at devoured both along with the fries. Each slider was a sloppy two-handed finger-licking-good hot mess as I tried to control the avalanche of ingredients from slipping out. I should've asked for more pickles, the cheese slice was pedestrian to the meal, and the kale slaw dressing was redundant since I ordered a separate side. Although the hot level gave me vapors, I felt I was man enough for the next "extra hot" or even final "reaper" levels, respectively. The fries were plentiful, perfectly crispy on the outside, moist/warm on the inside, and truly didn't need any ketchup and such. This was one very good meal yelp.com/user_local_phot…!

    SERVICE
    Thankfully, the line was short with only four people in front of me. After about a 10-minute wait, I easily placed my order, got a number, and about another 10-minute wait later I was called up to the pick-up counter with my entire order all packaged up and ready to go. Everyone I dealt with was chill, cool, and appeared to have a fun time. Kudos to everyone!

    PARKING (FREE; $1.00 this instance)
    Located in a small-medium strip mall with limited parking, I found a 2-hour timed meter at a nearby corner. Otherwise, there were plenty of metered and timed parking along the main drag of Western Ave. and all surrounding streets.

    ATMOSPHERE, DÉCOR, AMBIENCE
    A surprisingly roomy reverse L-shaped floorplan filled with several tables and chairs, there was a short line path that led from the front door straight to the order counter directly in front of you while the pick-up counter was just around the corner to your right. A handful of promotional posters hung on the walls but generally a nicely-kept restaurant. Plenty of natural lighting came through the two full glass walls and front door while soul-sucking electric fluorescent ceiling lights covered the rest. I counted four muted TVs yelp.com/user_local_phot… while chillout music played in the background.

    ATTIRE
    Totally casual, so I would normally be in a t-shirt, boardshorts, and flip-flops.

    OVERALL
    I was happy to have finally tried Dave's Hot Chicken and was a good gluttonous meal before Lent. The menu was extremely limited (they also had a small collection of standard bottled beer), so unless you really loved their take on Nashville hot fried chicken, your visits may be limited. Although I enjoyed the food and felt it was reasonably priced, I would be an occasional diner at best (I needed to try the mac & cheese!) if I needed a chicken fix since they were relatively close to me. Plus, it was always a pleasure to support a mom & pop small business. I found very good value based on the prices, service, and experience noted above (TOTAL paid experience was around $22.00 BEFORE any discounts and/or tip). And, they accepted my credit card of choice... AMEX! 4.0 STARS

    5/22/2020

    With the recent trend of hot chicken establishments popping up all around Los Angeles, it would take a lot for an establishment to really separate itself from the rest of the pack.  Whether that's from word of mouth, special cooking style, use of seasonings or whatever, it really is a tough field to distinguish yourself from.  Dave's Hot Chicken on Western does it pretty well.  They are not without their flaws, but from a straight taste and enjoyment perspective, this location does it pretty well.

    As expected, you come here for the hot chicken.  Period.  Don't bother with anything else.  They have good fries, but that's not what you're here for and that's definitely not why you wait in line for.  Speaking of the line, this place has a tendency to have pretty long lines.  Obviously, during the COVID times, that line isn't that much of an issue as you would order online and pick up your order at certain times, but they do have a tendency to get backed up so use your best judgement.  The current menu is limited, but luckily the combo's are portioned very well and are very filling.  

    The chicken, depending on your spice tolerance can range from mild to burnt your tongue off, but I found their spicy to be an enjoyable spicy and not numbing to the point of being painful.  That's the key difference.  You can still taste the complexity in their flavors, where other places you cannot and for me that's what makes them unique.

    Good thing is they do have other locations, but still expect a wait if you're arriving at rush hours.  However, I am glad that they're open and serving during these times.  Definitely a place to support if you can.

    Located in a mini plaza, but seems like parking is for employees only. There's metered street parking, but I came at 11 pm on Friday and we still had to circle a couple times.

    The wait wasn't bad at all, but it was more than I expected for that time of night. Maybe about 20-25 min from lining up to getting our food?

    Service was alright, but there was a hiccup. We ordered cheese fries. As we were waiting for them to call our number, we see them tell a customer ahead of us that they ran out of cheese sauce for their fries. He got comped with TWO orders of mac and cheese instead. As we continue to wait, we see an employee walk into the kitchen with 2 cans of cheese sauce to restock. When our number was called, nobody said anything about our cheese fries so we figured we were all good. We walked back to our car about a block away, and luckily, I wanted to snack in the car. That's when we discovered our plain fries. Had to walk it back to complain, and they comped us with ONE order of mac and cheese. So unfair. Why'd the other customer get 2 when I had to actually bring my order back?

    That being said, that mac and cheese was so bomb. Definitely getting that again. Even the regular fries were perfectly seasoned. I was so happy with my sides that I'm not even mad about the service.

    As for the chicken, it was pretty good. Not as juicy as I'd like, but still delicious. The medium tender had the perfect kick to it, but you need to go up a level if you're getting a slider. The flavor and heat gets lost in the bread.

    Definitely revisiting if I'm in the area.
